title: ‘Naked man killed Peeping Tom who was watching him have sex with his girlfriend’
text:
Victor Vickery is charged with manslaughter for allegedly beating Asaad Akar to death after catching him outside his girlfriend’s window. (Picture: Broward County Sheriff’s Office/Obituary)

An enraged naked man beat a Peeping Tom to death after catching him outside his girlfriend’s bedroom window while they had sex, police say.

Victor Vickery, 30, was arrested on Thursday for killing Asaad Akar, 57, who had reportedly been watching Vickery have sex with his girlfriend, Samantha Hobi, on July 3, 2018 in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.

Vickery told police that he had spotted a Peeping Tom outside the window before, but the man fled before authorities arrived.

This time, Vickery reportedly charged outside, still naked, and caught Akar with his genitals exposed. Police say Akar had prior convictions for prowling.

Vickery began fighting with Akar. Hobi called police and can be heard in a recording of the call repeatedly saying, ‘Tori stop. Tori that’s enough,’ according to the Sun Sentinel.

According to Akar’s obituary, he was ‘a devoted son to his ailing mother, and a kind soul, who was generous with his time and knowledge, to all that needed him.’ (Picture: Obituary)

In a police interview, Vickery said Akar lunged at him and began choking him. He continued to say that he kicked and punched Akar ‘a handful of times’ then held him down on the ground.

Hobi told investigators that she hit Akar with a shovel after she saw him choking Vickery – but she later changed her story to say that Vickery coerced her to say that, denying that she ever touched Akar.

Woman 'viciously stabbed boyfriend to death to try and get closer to sex buddy'

Akar was taken to a local hospital after the incident and later died of his injuries.

Hobi and Vickery reportedly had a tumultuous relationship before the July 2018 incident. She twice filed restraining orders against Vickery, who was awaiting trial for felony sex battery when he was arrested last week for manslaughter.

Court records shows that the sexual battery incident took place weeks after Akar was beaten to death, although police have not released many details regarding the case.

Vickery pleaded not guilty to the sexual battery charge, as well as to charges of burglary. He is currently being held in jail on a $100,000 bond.

According to Akar’s obituary, he was ‘a devoted son to his ailing mother, and a kind soul, who was generous with his time and knowledge, to all that needed him.’
description: Victor Vickery, 30, was arrested on Thursday for killing Asaad Akar, 57, on July 3, 2018 in Fort Lauderdale, Florida.
